weather.translation[0].definitions[0].de: the temperature and other conditions such as sun, rain, and wind
weather.translation[0].definitions[0].no: The weather seems to be getting worse
You also often use weather with an adjective such as good or bad
We had good weather all week
Games are sometimes cancelled because of bad weather
weather.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: good/nice/lovely
We’ll go out if the weather is good.
glorious/beautiful/perfect
It was glorious weather, so we decided to go for a picnic.
Several flights were cancelled owing to bad weather.
awful/dreadful/terrible weather
We came home early because of the awful weather.
Drink lots of water in hot weather.
The weather was cold and grey.
fine/sunny/fair/dry
If the weather is fine, we’ll eat outside.
Water pot plants daily during spells of dry weather.
wet/rainy
I’m so sick of this wet weather.
windy/stormy
In windy weather, water from the fountain is blown onto the paths.
have good/bad etc weather
We have had lovely weather all week.
the weather turns
The weather had turned mild.
the weather holds (out)
The forecast said the weather should hold until Tuesday.
the weather breaks
We got almost all the harvest in before the weather broke.
weather + NOUN
the weather forecast
What’s the weather forecast like for the weekend?
the weather map
The weather map shows a band of rain coming in from the east.
weather conditions
The rescue was difficult because of the appalling weather conditions.
weather patterns
Changes in weather patterns are thought to be caused by global warming
a weather station
a weather centre
The London Weather Centre has issued a warning that there could be extremely heavy rain and high winds over the next 24 hours.
weather permitting
Breakfast is served on the terrace, weather permitting.
weather.translation[0].note_box[1].secti: use this to talk about whether it is hot or cold outside or whether it is raining, snowing, windy etc
What was the weather like on your vacation?
a period of warm sunny weather
the usual weather conditions in a particular country or area
Queensland has a warm tropical climate.
what the weather will probably be like for the next few days
The outlook for the weekend is for continued sunny weather.
the weather at a particular time, especially when considering how this will affect a planned event or activity
Conditions are perfect for today’s boat race.
Freezing conditions are making the roads extremely hazardous.
The equipment had been left exposed to the elements.
weather.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to come through a very difficult situation safely
weather.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: The company weathered the storm of objections to the scheme.
Northern Ireland weathered the recession better than any other region in the UK.
weather.translation[1].definitions[1].de: if rock, wood, or someone’s face is weathered by the wind, sun, rain etc, or if it weathers, it changes colour or shape over a period of time
weather.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: The brick has weathered to a lovely pinky-brown.
Her face was weathered by the sun.
weather.translation[2].definitions[0].de: if a company, business etc weathers a difficult situation, it manages to come through it safely
weather.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: Small businesses were less able toweather the recession.
The company hasweathered the slump better than its competitors.
